METS:xmlData.entity:description: Prispevek je posvečen razpravi o vplivu dediščine preteklih upravnih meja in subjektov v Istri in na Reki na vzpostavljanje in zgodovinsko upravičevanje novih političnih enot, na primer občin in pokrajin, v 19. in 20. stoletju. Predvsem analizira, kako so sodobne upravne enote in subjekti predstavljeni v toponimih, simbolih in političnih diskurzih na Reki in širše na celotnem zgornjem Jadranu. Od 19. stoletja so politične oblasti in izobraženci upravičevali in legitimirali obstoj sodobnih političnih subjektov z geografskimi in zgodovinskimi analizami ter razlagami. Oblikovanje ali potrjevanje upravnih enot so spremljale jezikovne in vizualne predstavitve, ki so poudarjale ali zanikale pomen geomorfoloških referenčnih točk in zgodovinske dediščine. Tako kot pokrajine tudi mesta in občine niso fiksni subjekti, njihove meje in razmejitve, ki so včasih zgolj administrativne narave, pa vplivajo na njihov politični in kulturni razvoj. Ta prispevek obravnava vprašanje razmejevanja in poimenovanja celotnega območja zgornjega oziroma severovzhodnega Jadrana, ki je imelo v preteklosti različna imena in je bilo z upravnimi in državnimi mejami razdeljeno na različne enote. Prispevek se osredotoča zlasti na Reko in na povezavo tega mesta z njegovimi občinskimi in pokrajinskimi volilnimi enotami, od liburnijskega Lovrana, Opatije, Zameta in Kastava ter regij Gorskega Kotarja, do Suška, Kraljevice in Crikvenice, pa tudi Materije in Podgrada. Kako so te spremembe vplivale na politične in kulturne razsežnosti ter spoznavne zemljevide lokalnega prebivalstva? Kako je Reka predstavljena v današnjih in preteklih zgodovinskih opisih? Kakšno vlogo je imela fizična ločitev reke Riječine? V prispevku obravnavam tudi vprašanje, kako so bili Reka in okoliška območja predstavljeni s toponimi, grbi, zastavami in drugimi simboli ter kako je nanje vplivala povezava zgodovinske dediščine ter politične in kulturne stvarnosti.

This paper will discuss the legacies of defunct administrative borders and entities in Istria and Rijeka in the creation and historical legitimization of 19th and 20th century’s new political units, such as municipalities and provinces. In particular, it will analyze the representations of modern administrative units and entities in toponyms, symbols, and political discourses in Rijeka and, more broadly, in the whole Upper Adriatic. Starting from the 19th century political authorities and intellectuals have justified and legitimized the existence of modern political entities elaborating geographical and historical analyses and narratives. The formation or confirmation of administrative units have been accompanied by linguistic and visual representations which reiterated or negated the relevance of geo-morphological points of reference and of historical legacies. As provinces, cities and municipalities are not fixed entities, and their borders and delimitations, sometime pure administrative acts, have consequences in their political and cultural evolutions. This paper will address the problem of delimitation and naming the whole area of the Upper Adriatic or North-Eastern Adriatic, which has had different names and divisions along administrative and state borders. In particular the paper will focus on Rijeka and how the city has been related to its municipal and provincial constituencies, from the Liburnic Lovran and Opatija, to Zamet and Kastav, to the regions of Gorski Kotar, to Sušak, Kraljevica and Crikvenica, but also to Materja and Podgrad. How did these changes have affected the political and cultural dimensions and the mental maps of the local population? What is and was Rijeka in historical accounts? Which role has been the physical separation of the river Riječina? Ths paper will also attempt discussion on the representations of the of Rijeka and its surrounding area in toponym, coat of arms, flags and other symbols, and how they have been influenced by the conjuncture of historical legacies with political and cultural realities.
